Posts.Content: Wide awake once more because I'm in so much pain and can't take any pain relief as had my maximum dose within a 24 hour period. Steroid injection in my hip scheduled for Thursday but not confident that they know what is really causing all this. It's over a year since I finished active treatment and just when I thought I was back to normal this happens. Still not convinced there isn't a link to the Letrozole. Going to be a long wait until 29th October when I have my breast clinic referral. Anyway will have a good cry and take a deep breath and push on with things as not really got an option. Will just have to keep everything crossed that this steroid injection brings some relief from the pain.
Posts.Title: Awake and upset

Posts.Content: I have never had a bone density scan and have been told that I won't receive one until after I have finished taking the Letrozole. I'm currently taking 8 paracetamol and 6 ibuprofen a day and haven't been prescribed any pain relief. I did have a short spell of co-codamol which was given to me by A&E after I had a particularly bad day at work where I could hardly move and our First aiders insisted I went. Keeping everything crossed that the steroid injection does help as at the moment I can't get around without a walking stick even when I am indoors :(
Posts.Title: Awake and upset

Posts.Content: Thank you for the support I've been back at work full-time since the beginning of March and coping well until I began having these back and hip issues. Unfortunately I'm the main income earner therefore need to keep working if at all possible. GP thinks it is bursitis that is causing the issue so hopefully tomorrow's steroid injection in my hip will help get me back to normal. Have a good day x
Posts.Title: Awake and upset

Posts.Content: Hi Thanks for the input. I don't see oncology anymore they discharged me after my active treatment and am only seen once a year by surgery. You experience sounds very similar to mine I was originally told it was a sciatica issue but have become more and more debilitated now walking with stick is the only way I can get about. I did think about contacting the breast care nurses and discussing this with them to get a second opinion. Your experience makes me think I should Glad to hear things have improved for you it gives me hope that there will be a resolution to this.
Posts.Title: Awake and upset

Posts.Content: Quick update BCN has just given me a ring she has advised me to go ahead with steroid injection tomorrow but to also stop both the Letrozole and Risedronate for 4 weeks and keep a record of how I feel and any aches and pains I have then ring them back before restarting the Letrozole then the Risedronate. They've also told me to make sure they give me stronger analgesia to help me to deal with the pain. Thanks for all your advice and hopefully things will begin to improve now.
Posts.Title: Awake and upset

Posts.Content: I have seen my GP and he checked with the hospital and it was them who advised they would not give me a dexa scan until after I had finished the Letrozole. I was prescribed Risedronate in conjunction with the Letrozole so also taking calcium booster. I'm taking the Accord brand of Letrozole but do know that the manufacturer merged with another company a while ago and I did wonder if the content of them may have changed as the last batch as packaging and look of them seems a little different. Have had to stay off work today as just don't feel up to going in which is not great. Last thing I need is to lose my job!
Posts.Title: Awake and upset

Posts.Content: Thanks guys definitely going to try to contact BCN and have a discussion with her to see if the feel it could be down to the Letrozole. I'm also having challenges with my skin which is another known side effect so does look like there could be a connection.
Posts.Title: Awake and upset

Posts.Content: Hi Mazza I renewed my passport in February when I was bald and wore my wig in my passport photograph. I then went on holiday in July with a very short covering of salt and pepper hair and didn't encounter any problems.  Would suggest whatever you feel comfortable with go with it xx
Posts.Title: Passport Photo

Posts.Content: Thanks for that bit if infor Paula I didn't know you could have your photo updated. I wore my wig when I had my photo taken and really hate my picture. May re take it once my hair has grown :)
Posts.Title: Passport Photo

Posts.Content: I take Letrozole and haven't been advised not to have alcohol. I'm not a big drinker but have been on a couple in nights out where I had s few drinks with no after affects. I think if you have alcohol in moderation as with everything else you should be ok.
Posts.Title: letrozole and foods that contain alcohol

Posts.Content: You've just made me laugh out loud. Thank you needed that today as it's been a tough one. Thank you xx
Posts.Title: Modesty during surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Easy to say but try not to be nervous or embarrassed. Our hospital gives you a gown and the compulsory attractive (not) surgical stockings. You keep your own knickers on. You then walk to theatre and once there you're settled on a trolley and your arms are discretely removed from the gown. You aren't exposed or uncovered until your under anaesthetic. Same experience for both surgeries I had. Hope all goes well but contact your hospital and have a chat if you're still worried rather than stressing.
Posts.Title: Modesty during surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Sorry to hear you're having challenges with your PICC line. I was given tubigrip style sleeves from hospital when I went for my weekly line care. I also ordered some PICC line covers but if you do decide to do that. When I received mine they were too wide for my arm and also too short to cover my line. I ended up cutting up tights to cover mine.   Hope everything settles down for you. Linda
Posts.Title: PICC line - advice please

Posts.Content: Good to hear you being more positive. Good luck with chemo tomorrow. I'm a bit further on with my journey and have my final radiotherapy session tomorrow which I hope should be the end of my treatment. Hope you manage to get some sleep tonight.
Posts.Title: PICC line - advice please

Posts.Content: Good to hear a coffee and a chat has helped. Now I've had time to reflect think I'm concerned about not coping once I'm back at work. My other half isn't much help at home he's only helped ckean the house about 3 times over the last 7 months when I've been going through my treatment and hasn't even cooked!  Gardening is down to me too!!! My daughter also decided to leave home a couple of months ago which hasn't helped. Just not feeling very well supported at home. Sorry for having a moan. Sending you positive thoughts :)
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Hi Ossy You are entitled to feel emotional you've been through a lot and you aren't alone. I've only had to have lumpectomy and lymph node removal then chemo further surgery and radiotherapy and hadn't really had much of a meltdown but now that I'm finished treatment and looking at getting back to work and things becoming a bit more normal I keep having treaful episodes. It's great to know we have these forums to go to for support when we need them. Take care. Hugs x
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Snap I've been baking today too. 2 trays of Mars Bar Krispie cake and Marshmallow Truffles to take into work tomorrow. I'm sure your cookies are fab xx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Thanks Ossy think my husband just doesn't know how to deal with things. Have tried to talk with him but he just doesn't seem to get it. I've made a decision to ask to cut my working hours and asked him to share the domestic workload. Will have to wait to see how things progress. Will be back at work in a week or so on a phased return. Hope you're having a good day xx
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Hi Eden Good decision to join us. It's a great forum to gain some advice or sometimes just someone to chat to if you need some support.
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Hi Sharmer Hope you're doing ok. Welcome to the forum.  We are at different ends of our journeys as I've just completed my treatment and been at work today to discuss my return. Just wanted reinforce what everyone had said previously. You're not in this alone and the support you get through the forum is invaluable throughout your journey. There is always someone who can help with a response when you have a wobble. Good luck xx
Posts.Title: ... started my journey today
